channel.title: Open-iot-challenge-entries-rsses on Eclipse IoT
channel.description: Recent content in Open-iot-challenge-entries-rsses on Eclipse IoT

item.title: InMoodforLife | Is my Pi strong enough?
item.description: We need to be able to run all the algorithms for collecting and analyzing the data in a way more modest setup: an autonomous, always running, humble Raspberry Pi that will be installed near the Beddit sensor (in Bluetooth LTE range). Is it strong enough?

item.title: Agrinode | Develop an AgriNode bundle for Eclipse Kura (using Bitreactive)
item.description: In my previous post: MOSQUITTO (MQTT BROKER) DEMO. (MQTT broker is installed into a Gateway with host IP: 172.16.1.1:1883). In this demo, I build a bundle which is installed in Kura.

item.title: krishi-IoT | High-level architecture of krishi-IoT
item.description: In this blog, you’ll find a description of its internal components, challenges and thoughts.

item.title: InMoodforLife | Beddit Reverse Engineering
item.description: Before choosing a sleep tracker for InMoodForLife, we spent some time studying the specifications of the different available trackers.

item.title: Agrinode | MQTT Demo
item.description: Have a look at the our latest Mosquitto (MQTT Broker) demo.

item.title: dGator | A new year and a change to the project proposal
item.description: Change to original submission: instead of making the service available primarily only on CoAP I will be using HTTP.

item.title: Smart Watering | Setting up IBM IoT to execute OpenWhisk actions
item.description: Here is the latest Update from Cloud-Team on setting up IBM IoT to execute OpenWhisk actions.

item.title: Eneristics | Introducing the Residential Home Diagnostic System (RHDS)
item.description: Helping to create a more adaptable and responsive environment using open source technology.

item.title: Smart Traffic | Traffic Lights
item.description: Design was frozen and given to a manufacturer. Decent progress has been made. Though its not upto my satisfaction in terms of weight and size but pretty much for a POC that is fine. Here is how it looks like.

item.title: Sergevas | Rule-Based Fault Management for Environmental Monitoring IoT System
item.description: For a 3.0 edition of the Challenge Iâ€™m working on a Fault Management solution for a distributed Environmental Monitoring IoT system. The solution is based on a Rule-Based principles of errors (symptoms) detection and faults isolation and diagnose.

item.title: Smart Traffic | The Beginning
item.description: The idea of creating Smart Traffic Lights dawned upon my mind upon moving back to India. In absence of traffic lights at majority of the places, due to lack of funding, traffic goes at a snail pace.

item.title: Agrinode | Fully System Architecture for Agrinode Project
item.description: View the Full System Architecture for Agrinode Project

item.title: Introducing InMoodForLife | A sleep tracking and analysing device for young people with mood disorders
item.description: InMoodForLife aims to build a device to track and analyse sleep patterns for young people with bipolar disorders, in order to better regulate their sleep rhythms, contributing them to prevent mood swing relapses.

item.title: CCP | Life on CCP
item.description: CCP stands for Cloud-based Collaborative PACS (Picture Archiving and Communication Systems). A picture archiving and communication system (PACS) is a medical imaging technology which provides economical storage and convenient access to images from multiple modalities (source machine types)wiki.

item.title: Introducing krishi-IoT | An open-source, wireless IoT powered solution for agricultural applications
item.description: In this blog, we will post the updates about the progress we make and the challenges we faced in building the krishi IoT solution. Our team has already taking strides towards making krishi IoT reality. Please keep visit us for updates.
